intro: Psychotria arbutifolia, commonly known as the "Coca plant" in some regions, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces small, red, fleshy berries that contain seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Due to its association with the coca plant, it has cultural and traditional significance in certain areas.
